CEP150.name: Reflections on Learning
CEP150.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP150.description: Students' experiences as learners in comparison to psychological, sociological, and anthropological theories and assumptions about learning and teaching in and out of school.

CEP201.name: Current Issues in Education
CEP201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP201.description: Contemporary and perennial issues in elementary, secondary, and higher education.

CEP240.name: Diverse Learners in Multicultural Perspective
CEP240.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP240.description: Communicative, linguistic, physical, sensory, behavioral, affective, and cognitive differences in learning in multicultural classrooms. Factors that mediate access to knowledge.
CEP240.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders or in the Kinesiology major or in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities major and open to undergraduate students in the Child Development major.

CEP260.name: Dynamics of Personal Adjustment
CEP260.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP260.description: Theories and issues in psychological adjustment. Dynamics operating within individuals and in their interactions with others. Implications for learning, development, and well-being.

CEP261.name: Substance Abuse
CEP261.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP261.description: Effects of mood-altering chemicals. Treatment approaches and resources. Special emphasis on adolescent users.

CEP301.name: Literacy Instruction for Students With Mild Impairments (W)
CEP301.description: Reading and writing instruction for struggling learners. Characteristics of literacy problems in students with mild impairments. Adaptation for teaching reading and writing.
CEP301.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
CEP301.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities major and open to graduate students in the Special Education major.

CEP345.name: Language and Literacy Development and Disorders
CEP345.description: Language and literacy development. Communication delays and disorders and their impact on reading and writing achievement. Interventions for language-based literacy problems.
CEP345.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities Major.

CEP370.name: Educating Students with Special Needs
CEP370.description: Categories of special education. Identification criteria, prevalence, demographics of exceptional children. Interventions and instructional practices. Law, advocacy, and family systems.

CEP416.name: Teaching and Learning With Technology
CEP416.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP416.description: Uses of multimedia technology and social media in teaching and learning. Developing plans for integrating technology in classroom. Designing digital online portfolio as tool for professional development. Teaching school subject matter with technology.
CEP416.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Education.

CEP449.name: Behavior Management in Special Education
CEP449.description: Management practices for behavior problems and disorders. Applied behavior analysis, social skills acquisition through cooperative learning and cooperative discipline. Focus on problem-solving and peer collaboration.

CEP451.name: Models of Special Education Administration and Services
CEP451.description: Application of theory and research to special education program design and implementation.
CEP451.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities major.

CEP452.name: Assistive Technology for Students with Learning Disabilities
CEP452.description: Assistive Technology (AT) for advancing educational outcomes for K-12 students with learning disabilities; applications of technology to compensate for disabilities and improve educational, social, and behavioral competences.
CEP452.restrictions: Open to students in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities Major.

CEP460.name: Communication Skill Training for the Helping Professional
CEP460.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP460.description: Interpersonal communication focusing on dynamics of listening process, interpersonal style, and barriers to communication. Emphasis on the mastery of microskills.
CEP460.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

CEP470.name: Disability in a Diverse Society
CEP470.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP470.description: Needs and life experiences of persons with various physical and mental disabilities, types of services designed to meet these needs, multicultural issues relevant to disabilities, and career opportunities available in the field.
CEP470.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

CEP490.name: Independent Study in Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education
CEP490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP490.description: Supervised individual or small group study of the practice of counseling, educational psychology, or special education.

CEP491.name: Special Topics in Educational Psychology
CEP491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP491.description: Current issues in educational psychology and child and adolescent development in educational settings.
CEP491.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

CEP502A.name: Internship in Teaching Diverse Learners II: Learning Disabilities
CEP502A.description: Internship in heterogeneous classrooms. Increased emphasis on independent teaching. Teaching students with learning disabilities in classroom communities that ensure equitable access to important knowledge and skills. Assessing academic and social outcomes.
CEP502A.restrictions: Open only to students in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities major or to master's students in the Special Education major.

CEP800.name: Psychology of Learning in School and Other Settings
CEP800.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP800.description: Learning as active, socially-mediated construction of knowledge in school, home, community, and work settings. What is learned, how it is taught and learned, and what learners bring to the setting.

CEP801.name: Psychological Development: Learner Differences and Commonalities
CEP801.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP801.description: Development of differences and commonalities in learners across the lifespan. Contextual influences on development. Implications for learning in schools and other settings.

CEP801A.name: Collaboration and Consultation in Special Education
CEP801A.description: Professional and ethical responsibilities. Models and methods of collaboration with teachers, parents, and community agencies to foster learning for students with disabilities. Advocacy for students with disabilities in school and community settings.
CEP801A.restrictions: Open to students in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities major and open to graduate students in the Special Education major and open to graduate students in the Education major.

CEP802.name: Developing Positive Attitudes toward Learning
CEP802.description: Behavioral, individual-difference, and cognitive perspectives on student motivation to learn.

CEP802A.name: Reflection and Inquiry in Teaching Special Education I: Mild Impairment
CEP802A.description: Qualitative and quantitative research methods on teaching and learning of students with emotional or learning impairments. Framing educational problems in special education. Designing and assessing studies of mathematics and problem-solving.
CEP802A.restrictions: Open to master's students or educational specialists or doctoral students in the School Psychology major or in the Special Education major.

CEP803A.name: Assessment of Students with Mild Disabilities
CEP803A.description: Informal and formal assessment methods for planning and evaluating instruction and for classifying and placing students with mild disabilities. Engaging with families to improve responsiveness to the assessment.
CEP803A.restrictions: Open to students in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities major and open to graduate students in the Special Education major and open to students in the Educational Specialist in School Psychology major.

CEP804A.name: Literacy Instruction for Students with Mild Disabilities
CEP804A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP804A.description: Methods for teaching literacy to students with mild disabilities. Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data related to the teaching and programming of literacy instruction.
CEP804A.restrictions: Open to students in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities major and open to master's students in the Special Education major and open to graduate students in the Education major.

CEP804B.name: Advanced Diagnosis and Remediation for Students with Literacy Disabilities
CEP804B.description: Diagnosis and remediation of reading disabilities, differentiated instruction; literacy assessment and intervention practices for struggling K-12 readers and writers
CEP804B.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Special Education Major.

CEP805.name: Learning Mathematics with Technology
CEP805.description: Current technologies for teaching and learning mathematics with understanding. Technology for multiple representations of mathematical ideas, modeling, and authentic learning environments. Psychological and mathematical perspectives on learning mathematics.

CEP806.name: Learning Science with Technology
CEP806.description: Possibilities, ideas, and issues associated with teaching science with technology. How K-12 teachers use Internet resources (e.g. simulations, databases, communities) to facilitate science learning. Contemporary conceptual perspectives from educational psychology on important issues of learning.

CEP807.name: Capstone in Educational Technology
CEP807.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP807.description: Culmination of the Master of Arts in Educational Technology degree experience. Assessment and synthesis of educational technology knowledge and skill development.
CEP807.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Educational Technology major or approval of department.

CEP809.name: Data-Driven Instruction within Multi-Tiered Systems of Support
CEP809.description: Applying the multi-tiered systems of support framework directly to school settings. Integrating knowledge of instruction from other courses to make data-based decisions for students.
CEP809.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Education or approval of department.

CEP810.name: Teaching for Understanding with Technology
CEP810.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP810.description: Application and integration of productivity tools and web-based resources in educational settings to improve teaching and learning.

CEP811.name: Adapting Innovative Technologies to Education
CEP811.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP811.description: Application of instructional principles and methods to educational problems in the K-12 classroom. Development of technological applications which are interactive, multisensory, and innovative.

CEP812.name: Applying Educational Technology to Issues of Practice
CEP812.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP812.description: Applications of technology in K-12 settings. Identification, implementation, and evaluation of technology-based solutions to educational issues in school settings.

CEP813.name: Electronic Assessment for Teaching and Learning
CEP813.description: Foundational theories of assessment. Critical examination of methods (e.g., portfolios, rubrics, surveys, tests, self-evaluations), and digital tools that allow educators to gather information, analyze it, and make informed pedagogical choices. Design of assessments for learning, as learning and of learning, especially in digital contexts.

CEP814.name: Computational Thinking for K12 Educators
CEP814.description: Teaching computational thinking to K12 students.

CEP815.name: Technology and Leadership
CEP815.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP815.description: Professional development strategies. Project management, planning and evaluation. Relationship building. Ethical and social implications of technology integration.

CEP816.name: Technology, Teaching and Learning Across the Curriculum
CEP816.description: Uses of technologies in teaching subject matter. Disciplinary perspectives on teaching and learning with technology.

CEP817.name: Learning Technology through Design
CEP817.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP817.description: Design of educational tools and software. Designing for learners. Human computer interaction. Art and aesthetics of design. Iterative design. Collaboration in design.

CEP818.name: Creativity in Teaching and Learning
CEP818.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
CEP818.description: Value and relevance of creativity in education. Recognizing, analyzing, and supporting creativity in multiple contexts. Psychological, motivational, and organizational aspects of creativity.

CEP820.name: Teaching Students Online
CEP820.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP820.description: Strategies for constructing and implementing online curricula aimed at students across the lifespan.

CEP822.name: Approaches to Educational Research
CEP822.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
CEP822.description: Alternative methods of educational research. Identifying researchable problems in education and developing a research proposal. Applications of descriptive and inferential statistics for analyzing and critiquing published studies.

CEP824.name: Programming Concepts for K12 Educators
CEP824.description: Fundamental concepts of programming, computing, and computing systems for K12 educators. Instruction of computer science in K12 settings and subject areas.

CEP832.name: Educating Students with Challenging Behavior
CEP832.description: Evidence-based classroom interventions for students with disruptive and other behavior problems within general education. Effective teaching approaches for students with challenging behavior.
CEP832.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Education.

CEP833.name: Creativity in K12 Computing Education
CEP833.description: Intersections between creativity and computing in cross-disciplinary K12 contexts and subject areas.

CEP840.name: Policies, Practices, and Perspectives in Special Education
CEP840.description: Characteristics of students with disabilities and special needs. Implications for legal and professional responsibilities of teachers. Impact of federal and state policies on special education practices. Multicultural issues in special education.
CEP840.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Special Education major and open to graduate students in the Education major.

CEP841.name: Classroom and Behavior Management in the Inclusive Classroom
CEP841.description: Identification of behavioral, social and academic characteristics of children with special needs. Principles and techniques for classroom and behavioral management in the inclusive classroom

CEP842.name: Content-Area Instruction for Students with Mild Disabilities
CEP842.description: Principles for teaching mathematics, science, and social studies in inclusive classrooms that support learning for all students. Instructional practices for providing differentiated instruction and making adaptations and accommodations in these content areas.
CEP842.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Special Education major and open to master's students in the Education major.

CEP843.name: Autism Spectrum Disorders: Characteristics and Educational Implications
CEP843.description: Characteristics of Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD). History; etiology; past and present theories of autism spectrum disorders. Prevalence, comorbid conditions, research on ASD. Impact of ASD on learning, family systems, and communities.
CEP843.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Special Education major and open to master's students in the Education major.

CEP844.name: Applied Behavior Analysis for Teachers
CEP844.description: Concepts, principles, techniques, strategies, interventions, applications and research within the field of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). History of ABA. Data collection, measurement, design, analysis. Functional analysis. Ethical guidelines.
CEP844.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education and open to lifelong graduate students in the College of Education.

CEP845.name: Autism Spectrum Disorders: Assessment and Intervention
CEP845.description: Eligibility assessment, ongoing academic and behavioral assessment and corresponding established treatment interventions for students with Autism Spectrum Disorders.
CEP845.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education and open to lifelong graduate students in the College of Education.

CEP846.name: Autism Spectrum Disorders: Advanced Topics
CEP846.description: Theories, technologies, practices and research related to the education of students with Autism Spectrum Disorders. Academic, behavioral, social, and communicative programming for students with Autism Spectrum Disorders. Assistive and augmentative communication. Program evaluation. Creating service systems using ancillary, community, and family personnel.
CEP846.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Special Education major.

CEP848.name: Supervision in Applied Behavior Analysis
CEP848.description: Effective supervision strategies in behavior analytic practice.
CEP848.restrictions: Open to students in the Applied Behavior Analysis Major or in the Applied Behavior Analysis in Special Education Graduate Certificate.

CEP850.name: Technology and Literacy for Students with Mild Disabilities
CEP850.description: Use of technology to improve literacy learning and performance for students with mild disabilities.
CEP850.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Special Education major and open to master's students in the Education major.

CEP851.name: Concepts and Principles in Applied Behavior Analysis
CEP851.description: Fundamental elements, concepts and principles in applied behavior analysis.
CEP851.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education.

CEP852.name: Experimental Analysis of Behavior
CEP852.description: Basic behavioral processes and human and nonhuman learning with a focus on the experimental analysis of behavior.
CEP852.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education.

CEP853.name: Functional Behavior Assessment and Behavior Change
CEP853.description: Foundational knowledge and applied skills to administer behavioral assessments and interventions.
CEP853.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education and open to graduate students in the Applied Behavior Analysis in Special Education Major.

CEP854.name: Ethics in Behavior Analysis
CEP854.description: Advanced topics in applied behavior analysis with an emphasis on the Professional and Ethical Compliance Code for Behavior Analysts outlined by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board.
CEP854.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education and open to lifelong graduate students in the College of Education.

CEP855.name: Verbal Behavior in Education
CEP855.description: Applications of verbal behavior to language and literacy instruction for students with disabilities.
CEP855.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education.

CEP861.name: Counseling Theory, Philosophy, and Ethics
CEP861.description: Selected counseling theories. Foundations of ethical decision-making. Professional standards, guidelines, and issues concerning the training and work of the counselor and school psychologist. Legal issues and precedents.
CEP861.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Counseling major or Rehabilitation Counseling major or School Psychology major.

CEP862.name: Introduction to Individual and Group Counseling
CEP862.description: Forming, working with, and ending groups. Building relationships. Handling obstacles. Developing and carrying out agendas in counseling. Simulated individual and group practice.
CEP862.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Education and open to graduate students in the School of Social Work and open to graduate students in the Department of Human Development and Family Studies.

CEP864.name: Career Counseling
CEP864.description: Career development theories and labor market and occupational information. Assessing and planning aspects of career counseling with various populations.
CEP864.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Education.

CEP866.name: Psychoeducational Interventions for Children and Youth
CEP866.description: Theoretical and empirical bases for designing, implementing and evaluating intervention programs. Child and youth development. Understanding risk and resiliency. At-risk youth.

CEP868.name: Medical Aspects of Disability
CEP868.description: Types of physical disabilities and their implications for vocational rehabilitation. Theories of adjustments to and adaptation to physical disabilities.

CEP870.name: Foundations of Rehabilitation Counseling
CEP870.description: History, philosophy, values, legislation, policy and practice of the field of rehabilitative counseling.
CEP870.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Rehabilitation Counseling major.

CEP871.name: Cognitive and Psychological Aspects of Disability
CEP871.description: Types of cognitive and emotional disabilities and their implications for vocational rehabilitation. Psychosocial adjustments to chronic disease and disability.

CEP872.name: Social and Environmental Aspects of Rehabilitation
CEP872.description: Social and political factors that handicap individuals with disabilities. The Independent Living movement, philosophy, legislation and services. Accommodations and enabling technology. Attitude modification and client empowerment.

CEP873.name: Employment Strategies for Individuals with Disabilities
CEP873.description: Public policy, resources, and intervention strategies for assisting persons with disabilities to adapt to the work-place and to achieve vocational outcomes. Assisting employers in accommodating and retaining employees with disabilities.

CEP876.name: Professional Issues in Rehabilitation Counseling
CEP876.description: Applications of case management strategies, processes and practices in rehabilitation counseling.
CEP876.restrictions: Open only to master's students in Rehabilitation Counseling.

CEP877.name: Assessment in Rehabilitation
CEP877.description: Advanced assessment techniques and strategies for rehabilitation settings.

CEP879.name: Teaching College Mathematics
CEP879.description: Curriculum materials, case studies, approaches to teaching and student learning of particular mathematics topics.

CEP880.name: Cognitive Assessment
CEP880.description: Measurement of intelligence. Observation, practice, supervision, interpretation, and report writing in an educational setting.
CEP880.restrictions: Open only to Ed.S. or Ph.D. students in the School Psychology or Counseling Psychology major.

CEP881.name: Social and Emotional Assessment and Intervention
CEP881.description: Social and emotional assessment and intervention with children and adolescents in school.
CEP881.restrictions: Open to educational specialists or doctoral students in the School Psychology major.

CEP882.name: Seminar in Counseling, Educational Psychology and Special Education
CEP882.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP882.description: Seminar in the various fields of emphasis in Counseling, Educational Psychology and Special Education.

CEP883.name: Psychology of Classroom Discipline
CEP883.description: Theories of and strategies for the resolution of classroom discipline problems.

CEP884.name: Roles and Functions of School Psychologists
CEP884.description: Multiple roles of school psychologists from a systems perspective. Historical, legal, ethical, and cultural issues.
CEP884.restrictions: Open to educational specialists or doctoral students in the School Psychology major.

CEP885.name: Behavior Disorders in Children
CEP885.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
CEP885.description: Characteristics, causes, and treatment of school-related behavior disorders in children within a developmental framework.

CEP886.name: Psychological Assessment and Intervention I
CEP886.description: Psychological and educational assessments and interventions for learning, behavioral, and developmental problems of children and adolescents. Problem-solving assessment model. Informal and formal assessment methods and related educational measurement concepts.
CEP886.restrictions: Open to educational specialists or doctoral students in the School Psychology major.

CEP888.name: Theories of Child Psychotherapy
CEP888.description: Models of psychotherapy for children and adolescents. Empirically-supported, brief models appropriate for school and community-based practice. Critical appraisal of models, methods, and selected techniques.
CEP888.restrictions: Open only to Ed.S. or Ph.D. students in the School Psychology major.

CEP889.name: Consultation in School Psychology
CEP889.description: School-based consultation, theoretical models and consultation skills. Communication and interpersonal skills, conflict management, and joint problem-solving. Ethical issues. Research on consultation.
CEP889.prerequisite: CEP 880 and (CEP 881 or concurrently) and CEP 884 and CEP 886
CEP889.restrictions: Open to educational specialist or doctoral students in the School Psychology Major.

CEP890.name: Independent Study
CEP890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP890.description: Individual or group study guided by a faculty member.

CEP891.name: Special Topics in Educational Psychology and Educational Technology
CEP891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP891.description: Special topics in various areas of study in counseling, educational psychology and special education.

CEP893A.name: Rehabilitation Counseling Internship
CEP893A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP893A.description: Supervised internship experience in community rehabilitation settings.
CEP893A.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Rehabilitation Counseling major.

CEP893F.name: Special Education Internship: Teaching Children with Learning Disabilities
CEP893F.description: Supervised student teaching in elementary and secondary education programs for learning disabled students.
CEP893F.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Special Education major.

CEP893J.name: Special Education Internship: Teaching Children with Autism Spectrum Disorders
CEP893J.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
CEP893J.description: Supervised internship at the elementary or secondary levels, working with students who are identified as having Autism Spectrum Disorder.
CEP893J.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Special Education major.

CEP893K.name: Practicum in School Psychology
CEP893K.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP893K.description: Clinical experiences in a school setting as well as primary prevention, team decision making, and special education determination.
CEP893K.restrictions: Open to educational specialists or doctoral students in the School Psychology major.

CEP894A.name: Rehabilitation Counseling Practicum
CEP894A.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
CEP894A.description: Supervised practicum in a rehabilitation or human services setting.
CEP894A.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Rehabilitation Counseling major.

CEP894D.name: Practicum in Educational Psychology
CEP894D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP894D.description: Practicum in educational, business, or consulting settings. Possible projects include designing, developing, implementing, or evaluating instructional programs; conducting research; or working with practitioners to incorporate innovative instructional technologies.
CEP894D.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Learning, Technology and Culture major.

CEP894F.name: Practicum in Applied Behavior Analysis
CEP894F.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP894F.description: Supervised practicum in the use of behavior analytic practices, techniques, and strategies with children and/or adults with autism and other disabilities in school, home, or clinic-based settings.

CEP894G.name: Special Education Practicum: Children and Youth with Learning Disabilities
CEP894G.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP894G.description: Supervised field experience with students who have learning disabilities. Planning, implementing, and critiquing instruction in elementary and secondary school settings.
CEP894G.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Special Education major.

CEP894J.name: Special Education Practicum: Children and Youth with Autism Spectrum Disorders
CEP894J.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
CEP894J.description: Supervised practicum, at the elementary or secondary levels, working with students who are identified as having Autism Spectrum Disorder.
CEP894J.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Special Education major.

CEP894K.name: Internship in School Psychology
CEP894K.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP894K.description: Supervised experience in school psychology. Assessment, consultation, and intervention.
CEP894K.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School Psychology Major.

CEP895.name: Research Ethics
CEP895.description: Identifying and resolving ethical problems in research. Collegial interactions. Authorship, publication, and reviewing practices. Data management. Ownership of data and intellectual property. Conflicts of interest. Protection of human and animal subjects. Lab safety and compliance.

CEP899.name: Master's Thesis Research
CEP899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP899.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology and Special Education.

CEP900.name: Proseminar in Educational Psychology and Educational Technology I
CEP900.description: Historical, theoretical, empirical, methodological, and philosophical issues. Research literature on learning, teaching subject matter, and social-cultural contexts.
CEP900.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education.

CEP901.name: Proseminar in Educational Psychology and Educational Technology II
CEP901.description: Further work on historical theoretical, empirical, methodological, and philosophical issues. Scholarship and research skills.
CEP901.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Educational Psychology and Educational Technology Major.

CEP902.name: The Psychology of Learning School Subjects
CEP902.description: Psychological theories and research regarding learning and teaching of school subjects, including mathematics, science, and reading. Psychological learning contexts in and out of school. Transfer and representation of knowledge.

CEP903.name: Cognitive Development Across the Lifespan
CEP903.description: Cognitive aspects of human development. Relationship between cognitive development and learning in school and other contexts.

CEP904.name: Social-Emotional Development across the Lifespan
CEP904.description: Social and emotional aspects of human development. Relationship between social-emotional development and learning in school and other settings.

CEP905.name: Cultural Perspectives on Learning and Development
CEP905.description: Theories and research in cultural psychology. Relations among culture, learning, and human development in school and other settings such as family, community, and work. Implications for educational practice.

CEP907.name: Psychological Study of Teaching
CEP907.description: Research literature on psychological aspects of teachers and teaching. Topics include teacher's decision-making, learning from experience, and developmental changes.

CEP909.name: Cognition and Technology
CEP909.description: Interaction of computer technologies and cognitive theories. Learning with new technologies; how technology influences theories of mind. How theories of cognition may guide the development of new technologies.

CEP910.name: Motivation and Learning
CEP910.description: Enduring questions about motivation and learning. Role of skill versus will in motivation. Higher-order thinking in learning.
CEP910.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Education.

CEP911.name: Intellectual History of Educational Psychology
CEP911.description: Ideas and perspectives on learning and development that have shaped educational psychology. Learning of school subject matters. Learning and development in relation to educational settings.

CEP912.name: Reading Comprehension: Research and Theory
CEP912.description: Theory and research on the development, teaching, and learning of reading comprehension birth through adulthood.

CEP913.name: Psychology and Pedagogy of Mathematics
CEP913.description: Psychological theory and research on the learning of mathematics. Development of mathematical thinking and knowledge in school and other settings.

CEP915.name: Literacy in Sociocultural Context
CEP915.description: The learning and development of literacy and the role of literacy in mediating cognition, affect, and action in educational contexts. Relationship between literacy and sociocultural contexts.

CEP916.name: Intellectual History of Educational Technology
CEP916.description: History of technology and learning in formal and informal settings. Historical, theoretical, empirical, methodological, and philosophical issues in the study of technology in education. Teachers’ use of educational technology.
CEP916.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Education.

CEP918.name: Theories of School-Based Psychological Interventions
CEP918.description: Theories and models of school-based interventions. Theories of organization and purposes of schooling in society. Theories of prevention of psychopathology and promotion of children's competence in school settings.
CEP918.restrictions: Open only to Ed.S. or Ph.D. students in the School Psychology major.

CEP919.name: Cultural Factors and Evidence-Based Practice in Children’s Mental Health
CEP919.description: A multicultural approach to psychology, the cultural competence to serve diverse populations, a critical perspective on the cultural validity of mental health interventions, and awareness of equity and justice in practice and research.
CEP919.restrictions: Open to educational specialist or doctoral students in the School Psychology Major.

CEP920.name: Basic Concepts in Educational and Social Science Measurement
CEP920.description: Development and evaluation of standardized techniques for measuring psychoeducational constructs. Instrument development, validity, reliability, norming, and scaling using both raw score and latent trait measurement models.

CEP921.name: Psychometric Theory I
CEP921.description: Theory-oriented introduction to psychometrics and the measurement of educational and psychological traits. Measurement, scaling, validity, true score test theory, measurement error, reliability, generalizability theory, item response theory, measurement bias, and factor analysis.

CEP922.name: Psychometric Theory II
CEP922.description: Expansion of generalizability theory, test and item bias, and equating. Measurement of change, profile analysis, scaling approaches, and validity generalization.

CEP923.name: Item Response Theory
CEP923.description: Item response theory applied to test construction, scaling, and equating tests and their items.

CEP925.name: Applied Research in Special Education
CEP925.description: Research design and statistical methods for special education research in laboratory and field settings.
CEP925.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Special Education Major.

CEP926.name: Proseminar in Mathematics Education I
CEP926.description: Research on the learning and teaching of mathematics. Focus on curriculum, discourse, equity and teacher education.

CEP927.name: Proseminar in Mathematics Education II
CEP927.description: Research on the learning and teaching of mathematics. Focus on teaching, student learning, assessment and policy.

CEP930.name: Educational Inquiry
CEP930.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP930.description: Multiple sources of inquiry. Critical assessment of common assumptions about research. Relationship between data and theory. Objectivity, validity, and causal inference across research traditions. Research ethics. Relationship among researcher, researched, and audience. Question formation.

CEP931.name: Introduction to Qualitative Methods in Educational Research
CEP931.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP931.description: Concepts and assumptions underlying multiple traditions of qualitative research methods in education. Relationship between research questions and qualitative research design. Epistemology, methods, and ethical issues of ethnography, case study research, grounded theory, oral history and discourse analysis. Criteria for appraising and critiquing qualitative research designs, claims, and evidence,

CEP932.name: Quantitative Methods in Educational Research I
CEP932.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP932.description: Techniques in data collection and data analysis used in educational and psychological research. Graphical and tabular representation of data. Concepts of statistical inference in educational contexts.
CEP932.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Education and open to doctoral students in the Mathematics Education major or approval of department.

CEP933.name: Quantitative Methods in Educational Research II
CEP933.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP933.description: Advanced techniques of data analysis and statistical inference used in educational and psychological research. Multiple regression, analysis of variance, and basic principles of experimental design in educational applications.
CEP933.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Education and open to doctoral students in the Mathematics Education major or approval of department.

CEP934.name: Multivariate Data Analysis I
CEP934.description: Multivariate methods, matrix algebra, and the general linear model as applied to educational research settings.

CEP935.name: Advanced Topics in Multivariate Data Analysis II
CEP935.description: Application of discrete and continuous multivariate methods in educational research.

CEP937.name: Survey Research Methods in Education
CEP937.description: Principles and techniques of survey research methodology. Alternative sampling designs. Development of scales and questionnaires. Data analysis procedures. Emphasis on applications in education.

CEP938.name: Latent Variable and Structural Equation Modeling
CEP938.description: Principles and applications of latent variable and structural equation modeling. Testing substantive theories in the social, behavioral, educational, and biomedical sciences. Statistical modeling methodology for examining causality relationships between aspects of studied phenomena. Contributions to construct validation and theory development.

CEP939.name: Seminar in Educational Measurement
CEP939.description: Current issues in educational measurement. Ethics and standards in testing, educational testing policy, school effectiveness indices, and parameters of teacher testing.

CEP941.name: Academic Issues in Special Education for At-Risk Students
CEP941.description: Academic assessment and instructional research in special education. Inquiry in special education related to the design and evaluation of academic programs for learning disabled, mentally retarded, emotionally impaired, and other low achieving students.
CEP941.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Special Education Major.

CEP942.name: Single-case Experimental Designs for Intervention Research
CEP942.description: Research methodology course focused on experimental analysis of educational practices and interventions for individual students, classrooms, or schools.
CEP942.prerequisite: (CEP 844 and CEP 845 and CEP 854) or (CEP 900 and CEP 930)
CEP942.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Education and open to lifelong graduate students in the College of Education.

CEP943.name: Multicultural Issues in Special Education
CEP943.description: Relationships among race, gender, culture, social class, and disability. Individual, group and societal responses to disability. Anthropological, social and psychological theories about origins of cultural diversity.
CEP943.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Special Education major.

CEP944A.name: Rehabilitation Counselor Pedagogy
CEP944A.description: Pedagogical tools and issues associated with teaching and learning in pre-service rehabilitation counseling preparation programs.

CEP944B.name: Teaching Internship in Rehabilitation Counselor Education
CEP944B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP944B.description: Course design and teaching experience under the direct supervision of a faculty member.
CEP944B.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education Major.

CEP944C.name: Clinical Practice Practicum in Rehabilitation Counseling
CEP944C.description: Supervised counseling experience in human services, rehabilitation or educational settings to further develop skills, knowledge, and behaviors appropriate for professional counseling practice.
CEP944C.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education Major.

CEP944D.name: Clinical Supervision Internship in Rehabilitation Counselor Education
CEP944D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP944D.description: Theory and practice of supervising prospective counselors. Approaches, models, and strategies.
CEP944D.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education Major.

CEP946A.name: Regression Analysis for Education Policy
CEP946A.description: Foundations of regression analysis. Underlying assumptions. Applications to education policy with attention to challenges of establishing causal relations. STATA software skills for independent scholarly investigations.

CEP949.name: Critical Issues in Special Education
CEP949.description: Topics in special education, including cognition and sensory impairments, literacy for at-risk students, program design, small sample research, and staff development.
CEP949.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Special Education major.

CEP952.name: Technology for Teaching and Learning in Higher Education
CEP952.description: Technology for support of teaching and learning in higher educational settings. Theories, research, and design of online learning. Electronic portfolios. Libraries in the age of the Internet.

CEP953.name: Teachers and Technology
CEP953.description: Impact of new technologies on teacher knowledge and practices of teaching. Teachers' use of technology, teacher knowledge, teacher education, and changing roles of teachers.

CEP954.name: Design and Methods in Mathematics Education Research
CEP954.description: History, current trends, and issues pertaining to research design and methods in mathematics education research. Mathematics education research in the areas of policy, teaching, teacher learning, and student learning with particular attention to how research design influence research findings.

CEP955.name: Research Design and Methods for Educational Psychology and Educational Technology
CEP955.description: Research design and methods for studying learning, development, technology, and culture in educational contexts

CEP956.name: Mind, Media, and Learning
CEP956.description: Philosophy, psychology, and sociology of new media. Media effects and learning with media. Issues of gender, identity, culture in technologically mediated environments, including Internet, virtual reality, computer games, simulations, artificial intelligence (AI) systems, and pedagogical agents.

CEP957.name: Learning in Complex Domains
CEP957.description: Problems of learning in complex and ill-structured domains. Real-world knowledge application. Learning difficult subject matter. Situated, collaborative, and case-based approaches to learning in complex domains. Technologies for enabling new kinds of learning.

CEP958.name: History of Literacy Research and Instruction
CEP958.description: Key historical, political, scholarly, and educational issues influencing literacy curriculum and pedagogy.

CEP959.name: Acquisition and Development of Language and Literacy
CEP959.description: Language and literacy development with an alternating focus on early and middle childhood and adolescence and adulthood. Major areas of language and literacy development including phonology, orthography, morphology, semantics, syntax, and pragmatics. Connections between oral and written language development. Home and school influences on language and literacy development. Individual differences in language and literacy development.

CEP960.name: Theoretical Foundations of Counseling
CEP960.description: Theoretical models of counseling, personality, behavior change, and career development. Research literature on the process and outcomes of counseling. Selected professional issues.
CEP960.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education major or educational specialists and doctoral students in the School Psychology major.

CEP961.name: Advanced Perspectives on Culture, Diversity and Social Justice in Counseling
CEP961.description: Culture, gender, disability, and other diversity dynamics as they affect human functioning and counseling practices and multicultural education. Strategies and techniques for multicultural perspectives in counseling and inclusive pedagogy in counselor education.
CEP961.restrictions: Open to educational specialists or doctoral students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education major or in the School Psychology major.

CEP963.name: Ethics in Counseling and School Psychology
CEP963.description: Traditional and contemporary issues in theory, research, practice, and training with a focus on ethics including ethical theory, principles, standards, codes of conduct, and legal issues.
CEP963.restrictions: Open only to Ph.D. students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education or Ed.S. and Ph. D. students in School Psychology.

CEP964.name: Practice and Profession of Rehabilitation Counseling
CEP964.description: Foundations and practice of rehabilitation. Pre-service preparation issues. Professional and policy implications.
CEP964.restrictions: Open only to Ph.D. students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education major.

CEP965.name: Psychosocial Bases of Rehabilitation and Disability
CEP965.description: Practice and research issues in rehabilitation counseling.
CEP965.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education major.

CEP968.name: Research Methods in Counseling and School Psychology
CEP968.description: Research topics and designs in counseling psychology, with emphasis on the development of a viable research proposal.
CEP968.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Rehabilitation Counselor Education major or in the School Psychology major.

CEP969.name: Clinical Supervision in Counseling and School Psychology
CEP969.description: Theoretical, empirical, and practical aspects of the supervisory relationship. Process and outcome variables.

CEP972.name: Neurobiological Bases of Learning and Behavior
CEP972.description: Development of neural systems related to learning and behavior in children who are typically developing and children who have developmental or acquired disorders. Learning neuroanatomy, brain development, and the typical and non-typical outcomes associated with how children experience academic, social and behavioral outcomes. Influence and interplay among neurodevelopmental, genetic, and environmental factors.

CEP973.name: Child Neuropsychological Assessment
CEP973.description: Best practice in neuropsychological assessment of children, including interviewing, assessment, hypothesis testing and feedback.

CEP980.name: Writing, Research, and Theory
CEP980.description: Theory and research on the development, teaching, and learning of writing, birth through adulthood.

CEP981.name: Research on Literacy and Technology
CEP981.description: Issues, scholarship, tools, and scholars central to the research on literacy and technology.

CEP982.name: Seminar in Counseling, Educational Psychology and Special Education
CEP982.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP982.description: Seminars in the various fields of emphasis in counseling, educational psychology, and special education.
CEP982.restrictions: Open only to Ph.D. students in the College of Education.

CEP990.name: Independent Study
CEP990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP990.description: Individual or small group study, guided by a faculty member, in the areas of Counseling, Educational Psychology and Special Education.

CEP991A.name: Special Topics in Learning, Technology and Culture
CEP991A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP991A.description: Special topics in learning, technology, and culture in education.
CEP991A.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the College of Education.

CEP991B.name: Special Topics in Educational Statistics and Research Design
CEP991B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP991B.description: Special topics in educational statistics and research design.

CEP993K.name: Practicum in PhD School Psychology
CEP993K.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP993K.description: Supervision of practicing graduate students. School psychological service delivery to school-aged populations. Clinical research.
CEP993K.restrictions: Open only to Ph.D. students in School Psychology.

CEP994D.name: Laboratory and Field Experience in Special Education
CEP994D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP994D.description: Supervised experience working with students with disabilities in K-12 classrooms, for students who need additional experience in teaching environments.
CEP994D.restrictions: Open only to Ph.D. students in Special Education. Approval of department.

CEP994K.name: Internship in PhD School Psychology
CEP994K.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CEP994K.description: School psychological service delivery to school-aged populations. Experience in professional psychology.
CEP994K.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the School Psychology Major.

CEP995.name: Practicum in Research Design and Data Analysis
CEP995.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP995.description: Supervised research practicum. Design, execution, analysis, presentation, critique, and revision of research projects.
CEP995.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the College of Education.

CEP999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
CEP999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CEP999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Counseling, Educational Psychology, and Special Education.
